programme.title: Top10 Show
programme.desc: We present ten cars that have achieved cult status and are still adored by numerous fan clubs.

programme.title: Top10 Show
programme.desc: Sometimes you really have to question the taste of car designers. We take a look at ten of the ugliest cars.

programme.title: Top10 Show
programme.desc: They say beauty is in the eye of the beholder. We promise to remain objective when we present the most beautiful cars.

programme.title: Top10 Show
programme.desc: Car manufacturers regularly create special works of art that are limited, exclusive and therefore expensive. In this episode we show the rarest car models.

programme.title: Bentley Bentayga
programme.desc: With the Bentley Bentayga, the traditional British brand is entering the fastest growing market segment. This world's first luxury SUV is a conglomerate of superlatives on wheels.

programme.title: Biker Lifestyle
programme.desc: Lake Faaker is both a popular holiday spot in Austria and also a place with a special tradition. In early September, the region is the destination for thousands of bikers who celebrate their big annual event, the European Bike Week. (Part 1 of 5)

programme.title: Biker Lifestyle
programme.desc: Lake Faaker is both a popular holiday spot in Austria and also a place with a special tradition. In early September, the region is the destination for thousands of bikers who celebrate their big annual event, the European Bike Week. (Part 2 of 5)

programme.title: Biker Lifestyle
programme.desc: Lake Faaker is both a popular holiday spot in Austria and also a place with a special tradition. In early September, the region is the destination for thousands of bikers who celebrate their big annual event, the European Bike Week. (Part 3 of 5)

programme.title: Biker Lifestyle
programme.desc: Lake Faaker is both a popular holiday spot in Austria and also a place with a special tradition. In early September, the region is the destination for thousands of bikers who celebrate their big annual event, the European Bike Week. (Part 4 of 5)

programme.title: Biker Lifestyle
programme.desc: Lake Faaker is both a popular holiday spot in Austria and also a place with a special tradition. In early September, the region is the destination for thousands of bikers who celebrate their big annual event, the European Bike Week. (Part 5 of 5)

programme.title: Harley-Davidson Trio
programme.desc: We took a look at three very different Harley-Davidson models. The versatile Switchback Dyna, the motorized wheelie bike Sportster 72, and the bad-boy motorcycle Softail Slim.

programme.title: KTM 990 Adventure
programme.desc: It's very big and mostly comes in orange: the KTM 990 Adventure. Over rough terrain it's often driven standing up. Today, the 990 is considered the off-road specialist among travel Enduros.

programme.title: Facel Vega Facellia
programme.desc: In the late 1950s, the Facel Vega Facellia was designed to compete with Porsche and Alfa Romeo and open a new market segment for the fledgling French luxury car company.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: With the M3, BMW brought race car technology to the road. In addition: 120 years of Mercedes-Benz motorsports history. And: turbo power in the DTM. The Ford Sierra RS Cosworth taught its racing competition the meaning of fear.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: The year 1964 marked Opel's foray into the upper class market. The company presented its KAD series with the Kapitän, Admiral and Diplomat models, combining US design with solid German technology.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: The BMW 507 Roadster was cherished by superstars like Elvis Presley. Today, the 150 HP sports car from 1955 is one of the most valuable classics of all time. Also: following the footsteps of the iconic Porsche brand in a 356 Cabrio.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: Cars like the Ford GT 40, the Jaguar D-Type or the Mercedes 300 SL wrote history on the race track and now break records at auctions. A sumptuously restored 300 SL will start at the most famous classic car rally in the world, the Mille Miglia.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: We followed the restoration of the unique Bayer K67 research vehicle, the first all-plastic car in the world, developed in 1967 by the pharmaceutical giant Bayer.

programme.title: Lancia Stratos HF
programme.desc: The Lancia Stratos with Ferrari power, the rally icon of the 1970s.

programme.title: BMW 328 Schlüter
programme.desc: If a car arrives in a trailer, its value is usually very high. The original BMW 328 Schlüter is already rare and expensive. But this model is a reconstruction and it is absolutely unique.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: With the GTR, Nissan tried to take on the established European sports car manufacturers. For less than half the price the GTR was a more affordable direct competitor to Porsche's 911 Turbo S or the Audi R8 GT. In addition: one of the ultimate super cars, the Techart 911 Turbo S with 620 hp. And: the Pagani Huayra, presented and driven by Formula 1 Pilot Adrian Sutil.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: It's not always a car's pure power that makes driving through curves exciting. The Subaru BRZ with its low boxer engine and its well-balanced handling gives his driver a very good feeling for the road. The BMW 235i RS has a great rear wheel performance and the Porsche Cayman GTS with its mid-engine puts a smile on your face as soon as you put your foot on the accelerator.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: With the creation of its i8, Munich-based car manufacturer BMW makes a big step towards the future. After all, the futuristic looking car is the first German sports car which utilizes hybrid technology. Supercars checks out the BMW i8 on the streets of Los Angeles. But BMW did not just work on the i8. They also present the new sports coupe 435i and the sporty SUV X550d M.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: If you have only sat in the back of a big limousine and if you don't know how much these kind of limousines are, you are probably part of the management. When it comes to driving experience and performance, it makes sense that the driver¿s seat is less attractive. But that's only the case for seasoned state cars anyways. The Audi RS and Mercedes S-Class might even make some chauffeurs unemployed.

programme.title: McLaren 570 GT
programme.desc: Onboard the McLaren 570 GT on the island of Tenerife

programme.title: Going Pro
programme.desc: A racing team isn't just about driving; it also navigates the uncertainties and pressures of securing crucial sponsorship and financial backing necessary for continued participation in the championship.

programme.title: Going Pro
programme.desc: In the season finale at Hockenheim, tensions are high as teams compete for the ADAC GT4 championship. Defending champions Mike David Ortmann and Hugo Sasse face intense pressure after a challenging start to the season.

programme.title: Going Pro
programme.desc: Damon Surzyshyn embarks on a new chapter in his racing career, navigating ice racing in Canada before securing an opportunity to compete in Germany’s Nürburgring NLS series. Despite some challenges, he prepares for the legendary Nordschleife.

programme.title: Going Pro
programme.desc: Damon Surzyshyn takes on the Nürburgring Nordschleife, navigating the complexities of permit qualifications, unpredictable weather, and intense multi-class racing. Amidst several challenges, he pushes through to secure a strong finish.

programme.title: Dreamcars
programme.desc: The BMW X5M, Audi Q7, Mercedes GLS and Porsche Cayenne Turbo are among the strongest and fastest SUVs in the world. Sports utility vehicles made in Germany are the embodiment of technical perfection, superior performance and unique comfort.

programme.title: Dreamcars
programme.desc: Luxury, lifestyle and exclusivity, no other cars transport these attributes better than the SUVs by Jaguar, Range Rover, Bentley, Volvo and Infinity. These stylish and excellently equipped SUVs embody a spirit of adventure and a zest for life.

programme.title: Dreamcars
programme.desc: US SUVs and pickup trucks like the Cadillac Escalade, Chevrolet Tahoe, Ford Raptor or Dodge Ram are large, powerful and luxurious and exude the feeling of unlimited possibilities and adventure.

programme.title: Toyota MegaCruiser BXD10
programme.desc: The Toyota MegaCruiser BXD10 has its origins in the Japanese army. Its shape won’t win any beauty contests or achieve the best results in the wind tunnel, but this is not really the point with an SUV like this.

programme.title: Ford GT40
programme.desc: With their V8 cars, Ford showed that they were able to build race winners. The Ford GT40 was a prime example for that, especially in Le Mans.

programme.title: Aston Martin Rapide S
programme.desc: Aston Martin is breaking new ground with the sport sedan – the „Rapide S“. Ever since the official car of James Bond became the Aston Martin, this brand has achieved cult status. Desirable, timelessly elegant, 2-door sports coupes are the DNA. But even the venerable British brand does not escape evolution - because with the Rapide S, Aston Martin goes new ways.

programme.title: Ignition GT
programme.desc: The Volkswagen Touareg receives a comprehensive model update. Gugu drives MG’s electrifying Cyberster in Shanghai and Juliet samples the Toyota Starlet Cross.

programme.title: Buyer's Guide
programme.desc: We help a Forex trader find perfect the German sports car. Bakkies under the R500 000 compete against each other and we discuss the reliability of a diesel Porsche Panamera

programme.title: Garage Gold
programme.desc: We kick off the season with sending to George to the Old Car Show. And we kick off our Garage Gold Concourse competition with a Morgan Roadster and a Jaguar XK120.

programme.title: Petrolheads
programme.desc: We revel in 1950s Americana at the Airlink Adrenaline Air Show. Sbu finds out what car you would buy if money was no object. A BMW M235i is featured in Drag Kings and we witness a couple of daredevils attempt a hair-raising fire tunnel stunt.

programme.title: Auto Union Type C Silver Arrow
programme.desc: Every two years, cars from the past once again roar on the streets of Monte Carlo. The pinnacle of motor sports from back then, the Silver Arrow with 16 cylinders, the Auto Union Type C, still commands the highest respect from drivers today.

programme.title: Motorvision Specials
programme.desc: The Yas Marina Circuit in Abu Dhabi is the most glamorous race track of the Formula One. Khaled Qubaysi takes us for a spin on this exclusive behind-the-scenes look at the famous race track.

programme.title: Motorvision Specials
programme.sub-title: Team X-Raid at the Dakar Rally
programme.desc: Stéphane Peterhansel is the most successful driver in the history of the Dakar Rally. With the German team X-Raid he won the 2012 and 2013 editions of this prestigious competition in a Mini Countryman.

programme.title: Motorvision Specials
programme.desc: For more than a century man and machine have tried to tame the Pikes Peak mountain, where daredevils risk everything to be the fastest up the 20-kilometer road to the summit at 4,300 meters above sea level. We show you the highlights of the 2018 race.

programme.title: Motorvision Specials
programme.desc: Former World Rally champion Armin Schwarz is a legend behind the wheel. We accompanied him when he instructed other talented drivers in a Subaru WRX STI rally car in the snowy and icy, but also breathtaking landscape of Finland.

programme.title: Motorvision Specials
programme.desc: The Tourist Trophy on the British Isle of Man is the most famous motorcycle race in the world. TT Sidecar champion Klaus Klaffenböck and racing expert Lenz Leberkern explore the fascination behind this exciting and iconic racing event.

programme.title: BMW Active Hybrid 7
programme.desc: With the Active Hybrid 7, unlike with its predecessor bearing the same model name, BMW now banks on a full hybrid, which can also be driven solely with electric power.

programme.title: Maserati Quattroporte GTS
programme.desc: 1963, over 50 years ago, with the Quattroporte Maserati invented a new vehicle category, the sports sedan. This GTS model is already the 6th generation of this iconic car.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: Since the 1950s, the Mercedes-Benz SL has been regarded as the sports car legend par excellence. Beginning with the legendary 300 SL with its gullwing doors, the SL series stands for innovation and cultivated sportiness.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: The Ford Mustang is the icon of all sports coupes and convertibles - no other car conveys so much the lifestyle of the 1960s. With its striking shape and powerful engines the Mustang drove itself into the hearts of millions.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: The Beatles, Peter Sellers, Britt Ekland or the British royals, they all drove the Austin Mini. Designed on a napkin, the Mini starts an incredible career in 1959: the revolutionary Mini is considered the prototype of all small cars.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: A car that everyone knows and that almost everyone has ridden in, a car that has conquered all continents and bears an unmistakable nickname, the Volkswagen Beetle.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: Ferrari - the name alone raises the pulse. No other sports car has as much magic and myth as the fiery red icons from Maranello. Whether on the road or on the race track, these cars are the centre of attention.

programme.title: Facel Vega Facellia
programme.desc: In the late 1950s, the Facel Vega Facellia was designed to compete with Porsche and Alfa Romeo and open a new market segment for the fledgling French luxury car company.

programme.title: Saab 93 and Saab 99 Turbo
programme.desc: In 1937 an airplane manufacturing company was founded in Sweden that later became the famous car manufacturer Saab. We present two of their iconic car models, the Saab 93 and 99 Turbo.

programme.title: Beradino
programme.desc: A „bella macchina“, a beautiful car - but not designed by masters like Bertone or Pininfarina. Johannes Paulussen from Neuss in Germany built the Beradino by hand.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: The Jaguar XF-S is supposed to put pressure on BMW, Audi and the other competitors in the business class segment. Volvo take a different approach. Their S90 is captivating due to its Scandinavian design and economical four-cylinder engines.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: BMW offers the X2 as a compact hipster SUV for young people. The DS 7 Crossback, on the other hand, wants to convey the French lifestyle. And Jaguar's E-Pace enters the market as a smaller version of the F-Pace.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: With the compact SUV Velar, Range Rover attempts to reach a broader audience. Jeep relies on the tried and tested: the design of the Wrangler has remained almost the same for more than 60 years. Also: the Volvo XC60 and the Ford Edge.
